field.label: Enabled
field.help: Checking this box enables Suricata inspection on the interface.

field.label: Interface
field.help: Choose which interface this Suricata instance applies to. In most cases, you will want to choose LAN here if this is the first Suricata-configured interface.

field.label: Description
field.help: Enter a meaningful description here for your reference. The default is the DynFi Firewall interface friendly description.

field.label: Send Alerts to System Log
field.help: Suricata will send Alerts from this interface to the firewall's system log.

field.label: Log Facility
field.help: Select system log Facility to use for reporting.

field.label: Log Priority
field.help: Select system log Priority to use for reporting.

field.label: Enable Stats Collection
field.help: Suricata will periodically gather performance statistics for this interface.

field.label: Stats Update Interval
field.help: Enter the update interval in seconds for collection of performance statistics.

field.label: Enable Stats Log
field.help: Suricata will periodically log statistics for this interface to a CSV text log file.

field.label: Enable Telegraf Stats
field.help: Suricata will periodically log statistics for this interface to Telegraf via a Unix socket.

field.label: Enable HTTP Log
field.help: Suricata will log decoded HTTP traffic for the interface.

field.label: Append HTTP Log
field.help: Suricata will append-to instead of clearing HTTP log file when restarting.

field.label: Log Extended HTTP Info
field.help: Suricata will log extended HTTP information.

field.label: Enable TLS Log
field.help: Suricata will log TLS handshake traffic for the interface.

field.label: Enable TLS Store
field.help: Suricata will log and store TLS certificates for the interface.

field.label: Log Extended TLS Info
field.help: Suricata will log extended TLS info such as fingerprint.

field.label: Enable File-Store
field.help: Suricata will extract and store files from application layer streams. WARNING: Enabling file-store will consume a significant amount of disk space on a busy network!

field.label: File Store Logging Directory
field.help: Enter directory path for saving the files extracted from application layer streams. When blank, the default path is a "filestore" sub-directory under the interface logging sub-directory in /var/log/suricata/.

field.label: Enable Packet Log
field.help: Suricata will log decoded packets for the interface in pcap-format. Default is Not Checked. This can consume a significant amount of disk space when enabled.

field.label: Max Packet Log File Size
field.help: Enter maximum size in MB for a packet log file. When the packet log file size reaches the set limit, it will be rotated and a new one created.

field.label: Max Packet Log Files
field.help: Enter maximum number of packet log files to maintain. When the number of packet log files reaches the set limit, the oldest file will be overwritten.

field.label: Enable Verbose Logging
field.help: Suricata will log additional information to the suricata.log file when starting up and shutting down.

field.label: EVE JSON Log
field.help: Suricata will output selected info in JSON format to a single file or to syslog.

field.label: EVE Output Type
field.help: Select EVE log output destination.

field.label: EVE Syslog Output Facility
field.help: Select EVE syslog output facility.

field.label: EVE Syslog Output Priority
field.help: Select EVE syslog output priority.

field.label: EVE REDIS Mode
field.help: Select the REDIS output mode.

field.label: EVE REDIS Key
field.help: Enter the REDIS Key.

field.label: EVE HTTP XFF Support
field.help: Log X-Forwarded-For IP addresses.

field.label: Block Offenders
field.help: Checking this option will automatically block hosts that generate a Suricata alert.

field.label: IPS Mode
field.help: Select blocking mode operation. Legacy Mode inspects copies of packets while Inline Mode inserts the Suricata inspection engine into the network stack between the NIC and the OS.

field.label: Kill States
field.help: Checking this option will kill firewall states for the blocked IP.

field.label: Which IP to Block
field.help: Select which IP extracted from the packet you wish to block.

field.label: Block On DROP Only
field.help: Checking this option will insert blocks only when rule signatures having the DROP action are triggered. When not checked, any rule action (ALERT or DROP) will generate a block of the offending host.

field.label: Netmap Threads
field.help: Enter the number of netmap threads to use. Default is "auto" and is recommended. When set to "auto", Suricata will query the system for the number of supported netmap queues, and it will use a matching number of netmap theads. The NIC hosting this interface registered 1 queue(s) with the kernel.
